"I will give you tongue and utterance." Of all the precious assurances God has given me regarding my work, none has been more precious to me than 


                                   -142- 

this, that He would give me tongue and utterance wherever I should go. In places where there was the greatest opposition, every tongue was silenced. I have spoken the plain message to our own people and to the multitude, and my words have been accepted as coming from the Lord.--Letter 84, 1909, pp. 6, 7. (To the teachers in Union College," May 7, 1909.)
